cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving NNW today, turning north tonight then N-NE on Wednesday, paralleling the Florida west coast before moving inland along the north Florida Gulf Coast and then across the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend area, near the Steinhatchee–Taylor County coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect from the mouth of the St. Marys River, FL to South Santee River, SC (Atlantic side – north of PortMiami)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning along the Florida Keys (Craig Key westward) and the west coast of Florida from Flamingo to Ochlockonee River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast from Flamingo through Tampa Bay to the Big Bend; Keys; portions of the north–central Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Brief gusty squalls possible today; sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤3% chance)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side at PortMiami
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible today with localized ponding and minor urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low-end tornado risk in outer rainbands; hazardous rip currents along Atlantic beaches
